intro: Lavallea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine lavallea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically small, clustered in inflorescences, and display a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
